chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey in court.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey.  Attorney Alex Geocaris in court on behalf of Francesco Mineo for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense has received an offer, but it still missing some discovery materials. Defense requests a status date. Court grants requests. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Swanson, Br. 11.

Defendant Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey in court in person.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court in person for Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Defendant Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey in custody.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Isaiah Nicholas Lydale Harvey appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Crivello, Branch 36. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
